result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher W Buttrum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution for victim B.M.C. to be paid as a condition of probation, before costs and fees.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No contact with victim B.M.C. (dob 08/01/98) or her family members. No unsupervised contact with any minors without agent's approval (except for his own children). Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours, release for standard conditions. Commencing 05/26/16 by 5pm.

records.addlTxt: filed by the state
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Christopher W Buttrum in court with Attorney Edward J. Hunt.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentence hearing.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Hunt makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

7 MONTHS HUBER (CREDIT - _ days)

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: victim B.M.C dob: 8/1/98 or her family members
____No unsupervised contact with any minors without agent's approval (except for his own children)

RESTITUTION:  $157.50 to victim B.M.C. (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $243.00  (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  20 days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence 5/26/16 by 5:00 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 12, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Christopher W Buttrum in court with Attorney Edward J. Hunt.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion is not held today and held in abeyance.   Attorney Hunt requests an adjourned date for plea and sentence.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
